alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 2:52AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches. Extremely dangerous wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre Mountain Ranges. * WHEN...11 PM MST tonight until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel will be dangerous or impossible due to icy, snow packed roads and very low visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation may be life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Extreme wind chills can result in frost bite on exposed skin in less than 5 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
